name: Easy Firecracker Shrimp
description: Amazingly crisp, sweet and just the perfect amount of heat. It’s a perfect blend of flavors, and it’s just so easy to whip up!
recipeIngredient: 2 tablespoons sambal oelek (ground fresh chile paste)
10  egg roll wrappers (cut in half diagonally)

recipeInstructions.text: Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet or Dutch oven over medium high heat.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet or Dutch oven over medium high heat.

recipeInstructions.text: In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, sambal oelek, brown sugar, ginger and sesame oil.
recipeInstructions.name: In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, sambal oelek, brown sugar, ginger and sesame oil.

recipeInstructions.text: In a gallon size Ziploc bag, combine olive oil mixture and shrimp. Marinate for at least 20 minutes to 1 hour, turning the bag occasionally. Drain the shrimp from the marinade, discarding the marinade.
recipeInstructions.name: In a gallon size Ziploc bag, combine olive oil mixture and shrimp. Marinate for at least 20 minutes to 1 hour, turning the bag occasionally. Drain the shrimp from the marinade, discarding the marinade.

recipeInstructions.text: Working one at a time, place shrimp in the center of each wrapper, leaving the tails out. Bring the bottom edge of the wrapper tightly over the shrimp, folding in the side. Continue rolling until the top of the wrapper is reached. Using your finger, rub the edges of the wrapper with water, pressing to seal. Repeat with remaining wrappers and shrimp.
recipeInstructions.name: Working one at a time, place shrimp in the center of each wrapper, leaving the tails out. Bring the bottom edge of the wrapper tightly over the shrimp, folding in the side. Continue rolling until the top of the wrapper is reached. Using your finger, rub the edges of the wrapper with water, pressing to seal. Repeat with remaining wrappers and shrimp.

recipeInstructions.text: Working in batches, add egg rolls to the Dutch oven and fry until evenly golden brown and crispy, about 2-3 minutes. Transfer to a paper towel-lined plate.
recipeInstructions.name: Working in batches, add egg rolls to the Dutch oven and fry until evenly golden brown and crispy, about 2-3 minutes. Transfer to a paper towel-lined plate.

review.reviewBody: I can't wait to make the fire cracker shrimp

I recently made these and I love them. It is a good go-to for parties. Looks sophisticated and presents very well, yet it was easy to make. I added my own touch and made it extra special by adding peanuts to the marinade. Gonna try some cilantro next time.

Can you make ahead and refrigerate? Can you freeze them?

Sand Springs, Ok
